org.netbeans.modules.editor.settings.storage/1 1.54.0

Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Fields
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    org.netbeans.modules.editor.settings.storage.spi.support.StorageSupport
    Functionality of this Support can be obtained either from KeyStrokeUtils or from Utilities.
  • Deprecated Fields 
    Field and Description
    org.netbeans.modules.editor.settings.storage.api.EditorSettings.PROP_DEFAULT_FONT_COLORS
    This has always been meant for internal use only. As per general contract clients should listen on mime type specific Lookup for changes in editor settings.
    org.netbeans.modules.editor.settings.storage.api.EditorSettings.PROP_EDITOR_FONT_COLORS
    This has always been meant for internal use only. As per general contract clients should listen on mime type specific Lookup for changes in editor settings.
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    org.netbeans.modules.editor.settings.storage.api.EditorSettings.getDefaultFontColorDefaults(String)
    Use getFontColorSettings(new String[0]).getAllFontColorsDefaults(profile) instead.
    org.netbeans.modules.editor.settings.storage.api.EditorSettings.getDefaultFontColors(String)
    Use getFontColorSettings(new String[0]).getAllFontColors(profile) instead.
    org.netbeans.modules.editor.settings.storage.spi.support.StorageSupport.keyStrokesToString(Collection<? extends KeyStroke>, boolean)
    Use KeyStrokeUtils.getKeyStrokesAsText(javax.swing.KeyStroke[], java.lang.String) or Utilities#keyToString(javax.swing.KeyStroke[], java.lang.String, boolean)
    org.netbeans.modules.editor.settings.storage.api.EditorSettings.setDefaultFontColors(String, Collection<AttributeSet>)
    Use getFontColorSettings(new String[0]).setAllFontColors(profile, fontColors) instead.
    org.netbeans.modules.editor.settings.storage.spi.support.StorageSupport.stringToKeyStrokes(String, boolean)
    use KeyStrokeUtils.getKeyStrokes(java.lang.String) or Utilities.stringToKeys(java.lang.String). Note the differences in delimiter used by the two methods.
